title: Katarina Johnson-Thompson admits she considered quitting heptathlon before gold medal
text:

Golden girl Katarina Johnson-Thompson has admitted she thought about quitting heptathlon - but could not give up on her dream.

Britain’s multi-event queen lay awake all night after finally putting her demons to bed and being crowned world champion.

Tired and still emotional she emerged yesterday to declare: “From now on it’s just going to be smiles. Hopefully. I’ve cried enough to last me a career.”

She then proceeded to speak movingly about the lowest parts of her rollercoaster journey to the top.

How in Rio after another global championship tilt had turned sour, this time at the 2016 Olympics, she turned to Jess Ennis-Hill and told her she did not know whether she wanted to continue.

(Image: PA)

“It was probably in the moment at the time,” said Johnson-Thompson. “But I was fed up of this feeling that my performances weren’t up to scratch to compete against other heptathletes.

“I didn’t want to give up on something I truly believed but…”

She paused, wiping a tear from her eye, took a deep breath and with a smile continued: “I’m so happy now that I wasn’t crazy in thinking I could do this.”

In the Qatari capital seven years of pressure was finally released as she stood on the podium to receive her gold medal.

“Everyone’s got their journey,” she said. “It’s not been very straightforward for me. It’s not been easy for me. I had to move coach. I had to move country, I had to learn a new language and settle in. I tore everything up and started again.

(Image: Getty Images)

“The last two world championships have been heartbreaking for me, my mum and my team. Mid-heptathlon, I’ve gone back to my hotel and cried and cried for hours when things have gone badly.

“Those were the low points of my career, after the high jump in London in 2017 and the long jump in 2015 in Beijing. The Rio Olympics as well. I’ve had a lot of bad years. I’m just so happy that I came out in front for a change.”

Johnson-Thompson did not just come out in front. Her total of 6981 points improved by 26 points the British record, leapfrogging her from third to first in the UK rankings ahead of Olympic champions Denise Lewis and Jess Ennis.

Her 304-point winning margin was the biggest in a world heptathlon since 1987. It also ended the three-year winning streak of Nafi Thiam.

(Image: Getty Images)

Killing Eve star Jodie Comer took to Instagram to congratulate her close pal. ”We couldn’t be prouder of you,” she said. “You’re the best…it’s actually official x”

Johnson-Thompson’s focus now switches to the Tokyo Olympics where she will go from being the hunter to the hunted.

“I know what it's like to finish second and what it's like when you want to win and prove yourself,” she said. “That will be a dangerous Nafi I compete against next year. I’m going to have to step up.”
description: The 26-year-old tasted glory in Doha when she broke the British record with a score of 6,981 points to win gold for the first time
